posts.post_content:
They changed [Dreg Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreg Reaver) to Mr. Goliath here because they thought a Zombie would be more identifiable and resonant than a Reaver. Wizards wanted M10 to be a good intro to what people who aren't too familiar with fantasy already know about it, like zombies, centaurs, and simple yet powerful spell concepts like [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt), [Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleep), and [Rise from the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rise from the Grave)...the chances are simply better that a layman will latch onto the idea of a giant zombie than that of a Dreg Reaver.  
  
Either way, though, it doesn't really matter, as the pair of them are pretty much worthless outside of Limited.
posts.html:
They changed Dreg Reaver to Mr. Goliath here because they thought a Zombie would be more identifiable and resonant than a Reaver. Wizards wanted M10 to be a good intro to what people who aren't too familiar with fantasy already know about it, like zombies, centaurs, and simple yet powerful spell concepts like Lightning Bolt, Sleep, and Rise from the Grave...the chances are simply better that a layman will latch onto the idea of a giant zombie than that of a Dreg Reaver.

Either way, though, it doesn't really matter, as the pair of them are pretty much worthless outside of Limited.

Rating:

posts.post_content: This makes the 6th renamed reprint in the set. This is merely a [Dreg Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreg Reaver), renamed and reprinted. Both are zombies, so there's no creature typing there, so what's the purpose of making an entirely "new" card a set after the first was printed that's a replica in all but name?
